Header.title: Quicksign Landing Page
Header.paragraph: Quicksign streamlines document signing processes with its secure, user-friendly, and efficient remote digital signing platform.

About.paragraph: why you should use remote digital signature?

Services.name: Registration through e-KYC
Services.text: We need to register through e-KYC app through face recognition.

Services.name: Access Through Web Application
Services.text: We need to access to web application to sign a document.

Services.text: We need to upload the document to sign in web application.

Services.text: We need to select the place holder where to sign.

Services.name: Select Approval Hierarchy
Services.text: Select Approval Hierarchy of members who needs to sign.

Services.text: We need to ensure 2 factor authentication and sign accordingly.

Features.title: Secure Authentication
Features.text: Digital signatures use strong encryption techniques to verify the identity of signatories and ensure that only authorized users can sign documents.

Features.title: Audit Trails
Features.text: Each document signed digitally includes a comprehensive audit trail that records who signed the document, when they signed it, and the IP address from which it was signed, helping maintain compliance and traceability.

Features.title: Time Stamping
Features.text: Digital signatures often incorporate time stamps that provide a verifiable date and time at which the signature was applied, ensuring the integrity and temporal validity of the document.

Features.title: Non-repudiation
Features.text: Due to the unique identification features and encryption associated with digital signatures, signees cannot deny their association with a signed document, providing strong legal enforceability.

Faq.question: What is an e-signature?
Faq.answer: An e-signature is an electronic signature that is used to sign documents digitally. It provides a convenient and secure way to sign documents without the need for physical signatures.

Faq.question: Are e-signatures legally binding?
Faq.answer: Yes, e-signatures are legally binding in many countries and industries. They are recognized as a valid form of signature under various laws and regulations.

Faq.question: How do e-signatures improve workflows?
Faq.answer: E-signatures can help businesses streamline their workflows by reducing the time and effort required to sign documents. They also provide a faster and more efficient signing process, which can improve customer satisfaction.

Faq.question: What security features do e-signatures offer?
Faq.answer: E-signature solutions often include features such as audit trails, authentication, and encryption to ensure the integrity and security of signed documents. These features help prevent fraud and unauthorized access.

Faq.question: What are the environmental benefits of e-signatures?
Faq.answer: E-signatures offer environmental benefits by reducing paper waste and contributing to sustainability efforts. They also help reduce carbon emissions associated with printing, mailing, and storing physical documents.
